framework.name: Transformational and Inclusive Governance Encompassing Respect for the Rule of Law and Sustaining Peace

children.name: Outcome 1: By 2026, people in Guinea-Bissau enjoy improved  democratic governance, peace and rule of law and  their basic needs are met
children.description: By 2026, People in Guinea-Bissau enjoy improved democratic governance, peace and rule of law and their needs are met

children.name: Output 1.1
children.description: The institutional framework and the human and operational capacities of the State, non-State actors and agents of change are enhanced to support a transformational change and societal shift in favor of democratic governance and to respond to all citizens' needs.

children.name: Output 1.2
children.description: Inclusive political and intra/inter-party dialogue processes among all relevant stakeholders on the key reforms outlined in the Conakry Agreement, particularly the constitutional review, as well as national reconciliation, and citizen engagement, involving youth, women, and vulnerable groups, to con

children.name: Output 1.3
children.description: Inclusive political processes, including a fair and transparent electoral cycle and a strong and independent mediascape, are strengthened

children.name: Output 1.4
children.description: Access to quality justice services, especially for vulnerable people, and the promotion of human rights and gender equality are enhanced.

children.name: Output 1.5
children.description: A culture of independence and integrity across the judicial system, including through the strengthening of oversight and accountability mechanisms, is fostered and the reforms of the security sector and law enforcement authorities are supported to reduce impunity and fight against drug trafficking,

framework.name: Broad-based, Inclusive and Sustainable Economic Growth and Development

children.name: Outcome 2: By 2026, Guinea-Bissau has achieved structural economic transformation driven by enhanced productive capacity, value addition, blue economy and inclusive green growth that leaves no one beh
children.description: By 2026, Guinea-Bissau has achieved structural economic transformation driven by enhanced productive capacity, value addition, blue economy and inclusive green growth that leaves no one behind, while capitalizing on SIDS characteristics and ensuring sustainable use and protection of natural resource

children.name: Output 2.1
children.description: By 2026, capacities to foster resilient, inclusive, and diversified economic growth and sustainable human development, leading to poverty reduction and leaving no one behind are enhanced.

children.name: Output 2.2
children.description: By 2026, Enabling environment improved and private sector capacities, response to emerging market opportunities and contribution to productivity, growth, and livelihoods are boosted; Number of youth and women entrepreneurs with capacities built in economic activities

children.name: Output 2.3
children.description: By 2026, Stakeholders’ capacities in terms of disaster and climate risk informed development are enhanced.

children.name: Output 2.4
children.description: By 2026, Cities/communities better value the natural capital and improve their resilience to climate and disaster impacts as part of local sustainable and resilient economic development.

children.name: Output 2.5
children.description: By 2026, Sustainable governance and management of environmental and natural resources, including biodiversity protection, and renewable energy are strengthened.

children.name: Outcome 3: By 2026, the population of Guinea-Bissau especially the most vulnerable, will have increased and equitable access and use of essential quality social services, including in emergencies
children.description: By 2026, the population of Guinea-Bissau especially the most vulnerable, will have increased and equitable access and use of essential quality social services, including in emergencies

children.name: Output 3.3

children.name: Output 3.4
